title: What is React?
answers: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces.
It allows developers to create reusable components.

title: What is JSX?
description: Explain the purpose and usage of JSX in React.
answers: JSX stands for JavaScript XML.
It allows developers to write HTML elements in JavaScript code.

title: What are React Hooks?
description: Describe the purpose and benefits of React Hooks.
answers: React Hooks are functions that let you use state and other React features without writing a class.
Examples include useState and useEffect.

title: What is the virtual DOM?
description: Explain how the virtual DOM improves performance.
answers: The virtual DOM is a lightweight representation of the actual DOM.
React uses it to efficiently update the real DOM by comparing differences.

title: What is the purpose of Redux?
description: Explain the benefits of using Redux in a React application.
answers: Redux is a state management library that helps manage complex application states.
It provides a centralized store for all components in the application.

title: What is the difference between props and state in React?
description: Highlight the differences between props and state.
answers: Props are used to pass data from parent to child components.
State is managed within a component and can change over time.

title: What is the significance of keys in React?
description: Explain why keys are important in lists.
answers: Keys help React identify which items have changed, been added, or removed.
They improve rendering performance and should be unique within a list.

title: What is the useEffect hook?
description: Describe how and when to use the useEffect hook.
answers: The useEffect hook is used to perform side effects in functional components.
Examples include fetching data, manually changing the DOM, and setting up subscriptions.

title: What is React Router?
description: Explain the purpose and features of React Router.
answers: React Router is a library for routing in React applications.
It allows navigation between different pages without refreshing the browser.

title: What is the Context API?
description: Describe the purpose of the Context API in React.
answers: The Context API is used to share data across components without passing props manually at every level.
It is useful for themes, authentication, and language preferences.
